docs.lead_paragraph: In the forest of khaki, heather gray and chambray that is the Gap's store on Fifth Avenue and 54th Street, the 6-foot-4-inch Jeff Einstein is a walking, talking redwood. The instant a potential customer breaches the invisible border of his department, he approaches to offer assistance. ''Too bad I'm not selling cars,'' he jokes with one pear-shaped man after setting him up with a pair of khakis -- 40-inch waist, cuffs, pleats -- in less than 15 seconds. There's something self-conscious about Jeff's act, as if he's trying to prove to himself that he's comfortable with his job. Or maybe it's that he's overcompensating for having been a bit slow to tell me about it a few weeks earlier. (''I'm working in retail now,'' he had said cryptically.) Either explanation makes sense. Jeff is not your typical Gap salesman.
docs.abstract: Jonathan Mahler article on out-of-work executives, who must rethink their professional identities, personal relationships and sense of who they are; notes recession has taken particularly high toll on executives, especially in New York City area; women have been as hard hit as men, but seem to adapt better to job loss than white-collar men; photos (L)

docs.lead_paragraph: We hear about the miracles: the babies born weighing two pounds or less who grow up to play sports and graduate from high school, even college. But rarely do people hear the very sad stories of the thousands of tiny babies born months before their time who do not do nearly as well, who spend three months in the hospital, sometimes suffering crisis after crisis and finally emerging with lifelong sensory, mental or physical disabilities.

headline.main: Experts Strive to Make More Pregnancies Full Term

docs.abstract: Jane E Brody Personal Health column gives overview of factors that influence woman's ability to carry baby to full term and details what symptoms of early labor pregnant women should look for to avoid complications; factors such as maternal age, demographic background, prenatal care, body weight, pre-existing health conditions, history of premature birth and early uterine contractions can all increase risk of delivering premature baby; possible drug therapies and causes of infant mortality are charted; graph (M)
